# Roach Stewart

|birth_place=Lancaster, South Carolina
|death_date=
|death_place=Columbia, South Carolina
| module         =
}}Roach Sidney Stewart (January 28, 1881 â€“ March 16, 1948) was a college football player and attorney. A native of Lancaster, South Carolina, he was the town's mayor from 1918 to 1922. He attended the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where he co-founded the Order of the Golden Fleece,  the oldest honorary society at the university. As a member of the Tar Heels football team, Stewart was an All-Southern center.
